data.job_description:
About Clay

Our mission is to help organizations turn any growth idea into reality.

We see growth as a creative practice, not a formula. Finding and reaching your best-fit customers takes unique ideas and constant iteration. As AI makes execution faster and tactics easier to copy, creativity is the only lasting advantage. We're already helping thousands of customers - including Anthropic, Waste Management, Figma, and Ramp - go to market with unique data, signals, and AI research.

In 2025, we crossed $100M in revenue and raised a $100M Series C at a $3.1B valuation, backed by world-class investors including Sequoia, CapitalG, and First Round. We also completed our first first employee tender offer and launched a community equity round, for our customers, agency partners, and club members.

Some things to know about us:
â€¢ Our community includes 11,000+ customers, 150+ integration partners, 125+ agencies, 50+ Clay clubs, and 30k members on Slack.
â€¢ Our culture is unique inside and outside of work. Our team members are also DJs, activists, writers, clowns, marathoners, skydivers, psychedelic therapists, social workers, and more.
â€¢ All employees can work for free with world-class coaches who specialize in creativity, management, and more.
â€¢ Our operating principles - including negative maintenance and non-attached action - guide our work. Read more about them here.
â€¢ Read about us in the NYT, Forbes, First Round Review, and more.

Hear from our employees directly on our Glassdoor page!

About the Role

We're hiring our first GTME (Sales) Enablement Manager to build and scale how Clay enables its GTME (sales) organization. You'll own the systems, content, and training that help our Go-To-Market Engineers (GTMEs) ramp faster, execute with confidence, and consistently drive pipeline and revenue. As the first dedicated hire in this role you'll play a defining role in shaping how sales enablement works at Clay.

You'll join Clay's Global Enablement team and partner closely with Sales Leadership, Product, Product Marketing, and RevOps to build the foundation for a high-performing, scalable sales organization.

What You'll Do
â€¢ Design and scale onboarding and ever-boarding programs that accelerate ramp time and set a consistent foundation for success.
â€¢ Build and run workshops and certifications that strengthen GTME skills in customer storytelling, account management, consultative growth strategies, technical enablement, and executive engagement.
â€¢ Capture and scale best practices from top-performers through repeatable frameworks and playbooks.
â€¢ Develop and maintain a central hub of resources (playbooks, talk tracks, case studies, templates) to reduce friction and improve knowledge sharing.
â€¢ Translate new product releases and workflows into clear, customer-facing plays that drive adoption, retention, and expansion.
â€¢ Partner with PMM, Product, and GTME leadership to ensure alignment on launches, customer value, and scalable frameworks for growth.
â€¢ Measure enablement impact through adoption, performance, engagement, and revenue outcomes.
What You'll Bring
â€¢ You have 5+ years in an enablement or sales, ideally in a high-growth SaaS environment.
â€¢ You're a strong communicator and facilitator who's comfortable running workshops, certifications, and executive-level conversations.
â€¢ You're technically fluent and comfortable understanding data workflows, integrations, and automation concepts.
â€¢ You've built and scaled enablement programs including: onboarding, ever-boarding, certifications, and playbooks that improved adoption, retention, or expansion outcomes.
â€¢ You have experience building content and managing enablement systems (e.g., Notion, Gong, or an LMS) to centralize resources and measure adoption.
â€¢ You thrive in fast-paced, high-growth environments and know how to bring structure and clarity without slowing teams down.
â€¢ You're curious, collaborative, and excited to partner across GTM to ensure teams are equipped to drive growth.

Learn more about Clay, how we think about the world, the vibes and what it's like to work with us right here!

Clay is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We seek and celebrate diversity in its many forms. If you're excited about this opportunity but do not meet 100% of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply.

Qualifications: You have 5+ years in an enablement or sales, ideally in a high-growth SaaS environment
You're a strong communicator and facilitator who's comfortable running workshops, certifications, and executive-level conversations
You're technically fluent and comfortable understanding data workflows, integrations, and automation concepts

GTM Engineer (GTM Ops) @ Clay

We're looking for someone to build the systems that move deals forward.

This role is all about the heart of the funnel: pipeline management, opportunity workflows, deal acceleration, and post-sale handoffs. You'll work closely with go-to-market leaders to turn high-level goals into real, scalable systems. You'll spot gaps, solve for edge cases, and make sure the entire funnel-from first meeting to renewal-runs smoothly and intelligently.
What You'll Do
â€¢ Build and maintain the systems that power our opportunity management, sales handoffs, forecasting, and post-sale workflows
â€¢ Design AI-native automations that surface next-best actions, trigger timely follow-ups, and improve deal velocity
â€¢ Connect GTM tools into one cohesive stack-and evolve that stack as we scale
â€¢ Work side-by-side with Sales, and Customer teams to translate business needs into technical solutions
â€¢ Balance long-term scalability with short-term speed; we're growing fast, and we need systems that can keep up

What You'll Bring
â€¢ 4+ years of experience in GTM systems, revenue operations, or sales architecture at a fast-moving company
â€¢ Built or owned systems that support sales pipelines, post-sale processes, and customer lifecycle ops
â€¢ Enjoy working closely with non-technical teams and can turn messy problems into clean system design
â€¢ Strong sense of curiosity, tinkering and hacking
â€¢ Strong grasp of tools in the modern GTM stack as well as SQL
â€¢ Excitement about the potential of AI to make sales and customer workflows smarter and more automated

Hear about it from Varun, our co-founder!

GTM Engineer (Go-to-Market Systems & Automations)

(Austin, TX)

About Atmosphere:

Atmosphere is the leading streaming TV platform built specifically for businesses. Unlike ad networks or signage companies, Atmosphere is the only true TV company whose first priority is to entertain television audiences outside of the home. Our content is designed to be fun, engaging, and worth watching, transforming waiting rooms, gyms, bars, and restaurants into better experiences for customers and better businesses for owners.

We are the first and only company to think about both the business owner and their customers when creating TV content. With 60,000+ venues and a global audience of over 150 million monthly viewers, Atmosphere is redefining what TV means outside the living room.

About the Role:

Weâ€™re seeking a GTM Engineer (Go-to-Market Engineer) who blends strong technical execution with practical sales and marketing intuition to help scale Atmosphereâ€™s global expansion across bars, restaurants, gyms, airports, and other commercial venues. This is a hybrid role at the intersection of sales, marketing, and product, with a strong emphasis on hands-on engineering ownership of the systems and automations that power our go-to-market motion. Youâ€™ll design and build the systems, automations, and AI-powered workflows that power our business acquisition engine, serving as the technical architect behind how venues are identified, onboarded, and activated at scale. Your work will directly shape how efficiently and effectively Atmosphere gets into more businesses around the world.

This position will report to the SVP, Platform Sales & Marketing, and is on-site in Austin, TX. Availability to be in-office 4 days a week is required.

Key Responsibilities:
â€¢ Engineer scalable growth solutions by building integrations, automations, and tools that streamline venue acquisition, onboarding & customer support for bars, restaurants, gyms, airports, and other commercial locations.
â€¢ Leverage AI coding agents and modern development tools to rapidly prototype and deploy go-to-market experiments.
â€¢ Analyze complex data sets to identify growth opportunities and build dashboards that drive decision-making.
â€¢ Build and scale cold email systems for venue outreach, leveraging automation tools to reach bars, restaurants, gyms, and airports globally.
â€¢ Design and implement A/B tests, attribution models, and performance tracking systems.
â€¢ Build custom tools and workflows that enhance team productivity and campaign effectiveness.
â€¢ Create technical solutions for global market expansion, venue onboarding automation, and business retention initiatives across diverse commercial environments.
â€¢ Collaborate across departments to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
â€¢ Drive data-driven experimentation to optimize venue acquisition funnels and reduce the cost of onboarding new business locations worldwide.

Requirements:
â€¢ Bachelorâ€™s degree or equivalent practical experience in Engineering, Computer Science, Data, or a related technical field.
â€¢ 2-4 years of experience in engineering, data analysis, or technical roles with proficiency in Python, SQL, JavaScript, or similar languages.
â€¢ Experience in sales operations, marketing operations, revenue operations, or growth roles with a track record of driving measurable results.
â€¢ Comfortable using AI coding assistants and modern development tools to rapidly build and iterate on solutions.
â€¢ Strong understanding of digital marketing, lead generation, attribution, and conversion optimization.
â€¢ Experience integrating CRM, marketing automation, analytics, and other GTM tools (Salesforce, HubSpot, Segment, etc.).
â€¢ Ability to analyze complex datasets, build reports, and translate insights into actionable strategies.
â€¢ Self-starter with the drive to identify opportunities and execute solutions independently.
â€¢ Ability to work cross-functionally and explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Nice to Haves:
â€¢ Experience with streaming media, AdTech, or B2B SaaS platforms.
â€¢ Familiarity with cold email platforms (Instantly, etc), lead enrichment tools (Clay, etc), and CRM systems (Salesforce, HubSpot).
â€¢ Background in product marketing or technical product management.
â€¢ Familiarity with modern web technologies and APIs.
â€¢ Experience building internal tools or customer-facing applications.
â€¢ Knowledge of machine learning or predictive analytics.

Compensation & Benefits:
â€¢ Competitive salary
â€¢ Company Equity
â€¢ Company 401(k) with employer matching
â€¢ Competitive insurance plans
â€¢ Flexible Time Off Policy

Our Commitment to Diversity:

Donâ€™t meet every single requirement? Research shows that women and underrepresented groups often hesitate to apply unless they meet all the criteria. At Atmosphere, weâ€™re committed to building a diverse, inclusive team where creativity, innovation, and teamwork thrive. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesnâ€™t perfectly align with every qualification, we still encourage you to applyâ€”you might be the right fit for this or another role.

We're looking for a Sales-focused GTM Engineer to build and optimize the systems that power Loop AI's sales motion. You'll sit at the intersection of sales, technology, and operationsâ€”designing automated workflows, optimizing our CRM, and building infrastructure that helps our sales team work smarter. This role is ideal for someone who loves building things, thrives on automation, and wants to directly impact revenue growth.
What You'll Do:
â€¢ Build Sales Automation: Design and implement automated workflows using tools like n8n, Clay, and Zapier that streamline lead routing, follow-up sequences, and handoffs between SDRs and AEs
â€¢ Optimize the CRM: Own Salesforce configuration for sales workflowsâ€”custom objects, automation rules, lead scoring, and pipeline management that gives our team real-time visibility
â€¢ Pre-Demo Research Automation: Build AI-powered research workflows that automatically enrich opportunities with company intelligence, pain points, and personalized talking points before every demo

data.job_description:
Level AI was founded in 2019 and is a Series C startup headquartered in Mountain View, California. Level AI revolutionizes customer engagement by transforming contact centers into strategic assets. Our AI-native platform leverages advanced technologies such as Large Language Models to extract deep insights from customer interactions. By providing actionable intelligence, Level AI empowers organizations to enhance customer experience and drive growth. Consistently updated with the latest AI innovations, Level AI stands as the most adaptive and forward-thinking solution in the industry.

What You'll Do -
- Develop and own the integrated demand generation strategy for enterprise and strategic accountsâ€”including ABM, lifecycle, and outbound orchestration.
- Lead cross-functional planning with Sales, SDRs, Product Marketing, and Field Marketing to define target segments, buying committees, and high-impact campaign plays.
- Architect full-funnel programs that blend digital, content, events, direct mail, and outbound support into cohesive journeys that create and accelerate pipeline.
- Design and operationalize tiered ABM programs (1:1, 1:few, 1:many) in partnership with Sales and Marketing Ops.
- Define the customer lifecycle strategy and deploy nurture, expansion, and retention programs aligned to buyer and customer journeys.
- Architect and build autonomous outbound workflows using tools like Clay, n8n, or Make to identify and engage prospects
- Partner with Growth, Marketing Ops, and RevOps to measure pipeline contribution, velocity, and ROI across all programs. Own reporting for executive stakeholders.
- Enable and equip SDRs and Sales with personalized campaign assets, outbound kits, and campaign alignment.
- Continually test, iterate, and optimize based on performance data and field feedback.

Define the customer lifecycle strategy and deploy nurture, expansion, and retention programs aligned to buyer and customer journeys
Architect and build autonomous outbound workflows using tools like Clay, n8n, or Make to identify and engage prospects
Partner with Growth, Marketing Ops, and RevOps to measure pipeline contribution, velocity, and ROI across all programs
Own reporting for executive stakeholders
Enable and equip SDRs and Sales with personalized campaign assets, outbound kits, and campaign alignment
Continually test, iterate, and optimize based on performance data and field feedback

data.job_description:
At Qualia, we've built the leading B2B real estate technology that transforms the home buying and selling experience into a simple, secure, and enjoyable process. Our SMB and Enterprise products bring together users from across the real estate ecosystem---homebuyers and sellers, lenders, title and escrow agents, and real estate agents---onto a single shared digital closing platform, providing greater clarity and transparency to real estate transactions. Today, through our business customers across the country, millions of consumers use Qualia to close on homes every year.

### **WHAT YOU'LL WORK ON**

As Qualia embarks on the next phase of growth, we are seeking a GTM Engineer to build AI-powered systems that scale our go-to-market operations. The GTM Engineer will own end-to-end delivery of automation projects across Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success---transforming how our teams work with data, make decisions, and engage with customers. The ideal candidate for this role thinks architecturally about automation infrastructure, values sustainable solutions over quick wins, and approaches automation with a "test small, scale smart" philosophy. You'll partner closely with Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and Revenue Operations leaders and analysts to understand their needs, identify high-impact opportunities, and build intelligent systems that enhance human decision-making. You will own individual projects from conception through production deployment---taking full accountability for technical design, implementation, testing, and ongoing reliability. The GTM Engineer will establish best practices for responsible automation that the broader organization can adopt and scale.

### **RESPONSIBILITIES**
â€¢ Build scalable automation systems---from data enrichment and orchestration to customer intelligence pipelines---that connect customer, product, and engagement data into unified intelligence layers, driving better decisions
â€¢ Design and implement automated workflows that augment team capabilities across prospecting, customer risk detection, sales coaching, and engagement optimization
â€¢ Partner with Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and RevOps teams to translate operational challenges into technical solutions that are both powerful and maintainable
â€¢ Apply testing and monitoring frameworks that ensure automation works reliably, fails gracefully, and maintains data quality at scale
â€¢ Serve as a technical expert on responsible automation, educating stakeholders on when automation adds value versus when human judgment is essential
â€¢ Stay current on emerging GTM automation capabilities, AI tools, and data enrichment technologies to continuously improve what's possible for the organization
â€¢ Document and share learnings so that successful patterns can be replicated and scaled across other teams and use cases
â€¢ Collaborate with security and compliance stakeholders to ensure automation systems handle customer and prospect data responsibly

### **YOUR BACKGROUND THAT LIKELY MAKES YOU A MATCH**
â€¢ Prior experience implementing AI/ML solutions, particularly conversational AI and MCP integrations, and building AI-powered workflow automations for teams
â€¢ 4+ years of experience in GTM operations, revenue analytics, revenue operations, sales operations, or related technical GTM roles with demonstrated progression in complexity and scope
â€¢ Proven track record building scalable automation infrastructure that others can maintain---you think in terms of systems and patterns, not one-off solutions
â€¢ Strong proficiency with Clay or similar data enrichment and orchestration platforms (Apollo, Clearbit, custom pipelines)---with a track record of building sophisticated workflows, conditional logic, integrations, and production-grade systems
â€¢ Technical foundation in SQL for data analysis and Python for scripting and automation, or demonstrated ability to quickly develop these skills
â€¢ Experience working with APIs---both directly and through workflow automation platforms like Zapier---to pull data from multiple sources into cohesive workflows
â€¢ Passionate advocate for responsible automation who understands the difference between augmenting human judgment versus replacing it inappropriately
â€¢ Strong communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts for non-technical stakeholders and vice versa
â€¢ Detail-oriented approach to naming conventions, documentation, and architectural decisions that prioritize long-term sustainability over short-term speed
â€¢ Familiarity with Salesforce data model and integration patterns (lookups, upserts, SOQL queries, deduplication strategies)
â€¢ Exposure to Gong, Zendesk, Totango, or similar GTM platforms and their API capabilities is a plus

While this role is based in Austin, Texas, we're open to exploring remote possibilities for qualified candidates.

### **WHY QUALIA**

Qualia is made up of incredibly bright, mission-driven coworkers who are passionate about using technology to solve real-world problems---and we're growing quickly. In order to continue building an engaging and dynamic organization, we're committed to giving everyone the support they need to do great work.

Our benefits package is designed to allow our team members to be their best selves, both in and out of the workplace. In addition to comprehensive health plans, a 401k program, and commuter benefits, we prioritize family and personal well-being through professional development, parental leave, and a flexible time off policy. Qualia offers a robust online onboarding program to train new hires, biweekly all hands meetings, and a variety of internal virtual events to keep employees connected.
â€¢ We believe diverse perspectives and backgrounds are critical to building great technology, and our goal is to cultivate an environment where people feel equally valued and respected. Qualia is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace, and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, citizenship, socioeconomic status, disability, or veteran status.*
â€¢ By submitting your application, you acknowledge and agree to the collection, processing, and use of your personal information as described in our* *Employee Data Privacy Notice**.*

json.job_description:
About Clay

Our mission is to help organizations turn any growth idea into reality.

We see growth as a creative practice, not a formula. Finding and reaching your best-fit customers takes unique ideas and constant iteration. As AI makes execution faster and tactics easier to copy, creativity is the only lasting advantage. We're already helping thousands of customers - including Anthropic, Waste Management, Figma, and Ramp - go to market with unique data, signals, and AI research.

In 2025, we crossed $100M in revenue and raised a $100M Series C at a $3.1B valuation, backed by world-class investors including Sequoia, CapitalG, and First Round. We also completed our first first employee tender offer and launched a community equity round, for our customers, agency partners, and club members.

Some things to know about us:
â€¢ Our community includes 11,000+ customers, 150+ integration partners, 125+ agencies, 50+ Clay clubs, and 30k members on Slack.
â€¢ Our culture is unique inside and outside of work. Our team members are also DJs, activists, writers, clowns, marathoners, skydivers, psychedelic therapists, social workers, and more.
â€¢ All employees can work for free with world-class coaches who specialize in creativity, management, and more.
â€¢ Our operating principles - including negative maintenance and non-attached action - guide our work. Read more about them here.
â€¢ Read about us in the NYT, Forbes, First Round Review, and more.

Hear from our employees directly on our Glassdoor page!

About the Role

We're hiring our first GTME (Sales) Enablement Manager to build and scale how Clay enables its GTME (sales) organization. You'll own the systems, content, and training that help our Go-To-Market Engineers (GTMEs) ramp faster, execute with confidence, and consistently drive pipeline and revenue. As the first dedicated hire in this role you'll play a defining role in shaping how sales enablement works at Clay.

You'll join Clay's Global Enablement team and partner closely with Sales Leadership, Product, Product Marketing, and RevOps to build the foundation for a high-performing, scalable sales organization.

What You'll Do
â€¢ Design and scale onboarding and ever-boarding programs that accelerate ramp time and set a consistent foundation for success.
â€¢ Build and run workshops and certifications that strengthen GTME skills in customer storytelling, account management, consultative growth strategies, technical enablement, and executive engagement.
â€¢ Capture and scale best practices from top-performers through repeatable frameworks and playbooks.
â€¢ Develop and maintain a central hub of resources (playbooks, talk tracks, case studies, templates) to reduce friction and improve knowledge sharing.
â€¢ Translate new product releases and workflows into clear, customer-facing plays that drive adoption, retention, and expansion.
â€¢ Partner with PMM, Product, and GTME leadership to ensure alignment on launches, customer value, and scalable frameworks for growth.
â€¢ Measure enablement impact through adoption, performance, engagement, and revenue outcomes.
What You'll Bring
â€¢ You have 5+ years in an enablement or sales, ideally in a high-growth SaaS environment.
â€¢ You're a strong communicator and facilitator who's comfortable running workshops, certifications, and executive-level conversations.
â€¢ You're technically fluent and comfortable understanding data workflows, integrations, and automation concepts.
â€¢ You've built and scaled enablement programs including: onboarding, ever-boarding, certifications, and playbooks that improved adoption, retention, or expansion outcomes.
â€¢ You have experience building content and managing enablement systems (e.g., Notion, Gong, or an LMS) to centralize resources and measure adoption.
â€¢ You thrive in fast-paced, high-growth environments and know how to bring structure and clarity without slowing teams down.
â€¢ You're curious, collaborative, and excited to partner across GTM to ensure teams are equipped to drive growth.

Learn more about Clay, how we think about the world, the vibes and what it's like to work with us right here!

Clay is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We seek and celebrate diversity in its many forms. If you're excited about this opportunity but do not meet 100% of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply.

Qualifications: You have 5+ years in an enablement or sales, ideally in a high-growth SaaS environment
You're a strong communicator and facilitator who's comfortable running workshops, certifications, and executive-level conversations
You're technically fluent and comfortable understanding data workflows, integrations, and automation concepts
You've built and scaled enablement programs including: onboarding, ever-boarding, certifications, and playbooks that improved adoption, retention, or expansion outcomes

About Clay

Our mission is to help organizations turn any growth idea into reality.

We see growth as a creative practice, not a formula. Finding and reaching your best-fit customers takes unique ideas and constant iteration. As AI makes execution faster and tactics easier to copy, creativity is the only lasting advantage. We're already helping thousands of customers - including Anthropic, Waste Management, Figma, and Ramp - go to market with unique data, signals, and AI research.

In 2025, we crossed $100M in revenue and raised a $100M Series C at a $3.1B valuation, backed by world-class investors including Sequoia, CapitalG, and First Round. We also completed our first first employee tender offer and launched a community equity round, for our customers, agency partners, and club members.

Some things to know about us:
â€¢ Our community includes 11,000+ customers, 150+ integration partners, 125+ agencies, 50+ Clay clubs, and 30k members on Slack.
â€¢ Our culture is unique inside and outside of work. Our team members are also DJs, activists, writers, clowns, marathoners, skydivers, psychedelic therapists, social workers, and more.

â€¢ Our operating principles - including negative maintenance and non-attached action - guide our work. Read more about them here.
â€¢ Read about us in the NYT, Forbes, First Round Review, and more.

Hear from our employees directly on our Glassdoor page!

GTM Engineer @ Clay

json.job_description:
At Qualia, we've built the leading B2B real estate technology that transforms the home buying and selling experience into a simple, secure, and enjoyable process. Our SMB and Enterprise products bring together users from across the real estate ecosystem---homebuyers and sellers, lenders, title and escrow agents, and real estate agents---onto a single shared digital closing platform, providing greater clarity and transparency to real estate transactions. Today, through our business customers across the country, millions of consumers use Qualia to close on homes every year.

### **WHAT YOU'LL WORK ON**

As Qualia embarks on the next phase of growth, we are seeking a GTM Engineer to build AI-powered systems that scale our go-to-market operations. The GTM Engineer will own end-to-end delivery of automation projects across Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success---transforming how our teams work with data, make decisions, and engage with customers. The ideal candidate for this role thinks architecturally about automation infrastructure, values sustainable solutions over quick wins, and approaches automation with a "test small, scale smart" philosophy. You'll partner closely with Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and Revenue Operations leaders and analysts to understand their needs, identify high-impact opportunities, and build intelligent systems that enhance human decision-making. You will own individual projects from conception through production deployment---taking full accountability for technical design, implementation, testing, and ongoing reliability. The GTM Engineer will establish best practices for responsible automation that the broader organization can adopt and scale.

### **RESPONSIBILITIES**
â€¢ Build scalable automation systems---from data enrichment and orchestration to customer intelligence pipelines---that connect customer, product, and engagement data into unified intelligence layers, driving better decisions
â€¢ Design and implement automated workflows that augment team capabilities across prospecting, customer risk detection, sales coaching, and engagement optimization
â€¢ Partner with Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and RevOps teams to translate operational challenges into technical solutions that are both powerful and maintainable
â€¢ Apply testing and monitoring frameworks that ensure automation works reliably, fails gracefully, and maintains data quality at scale
â€¢ Serve as a technical expert on responsible automation, educating stakeholders on when automation adds value versus when human judgment is essential
â€¢ Stay current on emerging GTM automation capabilities, AI tools, and data enrichment technologies to continuously improve what's possible for the organization
â€¢ Document and share learnings so that successful patterns can be replicated and scaled across other teams and use cases
â€¢ Collaborate with security and compliance stakeholders to ensure automation systems handle customer and prospect data responsibly

### **YOUR BACKGROUND THAT LIKELY MAKES YOU A MATCH**
â€¢ Prior experience implementing AI/ML solutions, particularly conversational AI and MCP integrations, and building AI-powered workflow automations for teams
â€¢ 4+ years of experience in GTM operations, revenue analytics, revenue operations, sales operations, or related technical GTM roles with demonstrated progression in complexity and scope
â€¢ Proven track record building scalable automation infrastructure that others can maintain---you think in terms of systems and patterns, not one-off solutions
â€¢ Strong proficiency with Clay or similar data enrichment and orchestration platforms (Apollo, Clearbit, custom pipelines)---with a track record of building sophisticated workflows, conditional logic, integrations, and production-grade systems
â€¢ Technical foundation in SQL for data analysis and Python for scripting and automation, or demonstrated ability to quickly develop these skills
â€¢ Experience working with APIs---both directly and through workflow automation platforms like Zapier---to pull data from multiple sources into cohesive workflows
â€¢ Passionate advocate for responsible automation who understands the difference between augmenting human judgment versus replacing it inappropriately
â€¢ Strong communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts for non-technical stakeholders and vice versa
â€¢ Detail-oriented approach to naming conventions, documentation, and architectural decisions that prioritize long-term sustainability over short-term speed
â€¢ Familiarity with Salesforce data model and integration patterns (lookups, upserts, SOQL queries, deduplication strategies)
â€¢ Exposure to Gong, Zendesk, Totango, or similar GTM platforms and their API capabilities is a plus

While this role is based in Austin, Texas, we're open to exploring remote possibilities for qualified candidates.

### **WHY QUALIA**

Qualia is made up of incredibly bright, mission-driven coworkers who are passionate about using technology to solve real-world problems---and we're growing quickly. In order to continue building an engaging and dynamic organization, we're committed to giving everyone the support they need to do great work.

Our benefits package is designed to allow our team members to be their best selves, both in and out of the workplace. In addition to comprehensive health plans, a 401k program, and commuter benefits, we prioritize family and personal well-being through professional development, parental leave, and a flexible time off policy. Qualia offers a robust online onboarding program to train new hires, biweekly all hands meetings, and a variety of internal virtual events to keep employees connected.
â€¢ We believe diverse perspectives and backgrounds are critical to building great technology, and our goal is to cultivate an environment where people feel equally valued and respected. Qualia is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace, and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, citizenship, socioeconomic status, disability, or veteran status.*
â€¢ By submitting your application, you acknowledge and agree to the collection, processing, and use of your personal information as described in our* *Employee Data Privacy Notice**.*

Build the engine. Automate the stack. Scale the mission.

Medical error is the third leading cause of death worldwideâ€”and 80% stem from miscommunication. SimConverse is fixing this. Our AI-powered simulation platform is changing how healthcare professionals learn, and weâ€™re now scaling fast in the US.

We have just hired our first Founding GTM/Ops Lead, a "systems architect" focused on high-level data and strategy. We are now hiring their counterpart: a Founding GTM Engineer to be the hands-on "builder."

This is not a traditional RevOps role. You wonâ€™t inherit a broken system; you will build a new one from scratch. You will be the technical owner of our entire GTM stack, responsible for engineering the automated engine that powers our US expansion from zero.
Why This Role Is Different
â€¢ First in, First Impact: You are the founding engineer of our GTM systems. You will build and own the entire GTM tech stack from day one.
